required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Young Patient With Aortic Dissection or Aneurysm: A Prospective Observational Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Characters, Treatment and Prognosis of the Young Patient With Aortic Dissection or Aneurysm: A Prospective Observational Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Aortic dissection or aneurysm is unusual in young patients, and frequently associated with unusual presentations. However studies about this area is scarce. Besides, the treatment option is not clare. The prognosis of this cohort is also unclear.
The goal of this study was to better understand the characters, treatment option and prognosis of young patient with aortic dissection or aneurysm.

detailed_description.textblock: To understand the clinical characteristics, treatment options and prognosis of aortic dissection or aneurysm in young people，the study plan will include young people younger (≤50 years) with aortic dissection or aneurysm from 2020.6. Then collect their clinical data and conduct follow-up studies, in order to understand younger aortic dissection or aneurysm patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical features of young aortic dissection and aneurysm patients
primary_outcome.description: Collecting clinical data, such as basic information, blood biochemical information and imaging informatio to describe the characteristics of young people.

arm_group.arm_group_label: younger aortic dissection or aneurysm patients
arm_group.description: this is an observation cohort study about younger aortic dissection or aneurysm patients without intervention.

intervention.arm_group_label: younger aortic dissection or aneurysm patients

biospec_descr.textblock: To explore pathogenic genes 5m peripheral blood was extracted for whole genome sequencing.

study_pop.textblock: young patients aged less than 50 years old and had aortic dissection or aneurysm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- young patients with aortic dissection or aneurysm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Aortic dissection or aneurysm due to traumatic

link.description: Characterizing the young patient with aortic dissection: results from the International Registry of Aortic Dissection (IRAD).

reference.citation: Januzzi JL, Isselbacher EM, Fattori R, Cooper JV, Smith DE, Fang J, Eagle KA, Mehta RH, Nienaber CA, Pape LA; International Registry of Aortic Dissection (IRAD). Characterizing the young patient with aortic dissection: results from the International Registry of Aortic Dissection (IRAD). J Am Coll Cardiol. 2004 Feb 18;43(4):665-9.
